rankings.description:
ORA402 - Provably Fair On-Chain Lottery:

Frontend: 
-- User picks a number (1-402) in the UI -> API responds with X402 payment request -> UI wraps SOL to wSOL and pays 0.003 SOL to backend

Backend orchestrates on-chain:
-- submit_guess -> deposit_to_pool -> request_randomness (Orao VRF) -> reveal_result -> close_game (loss) or payout (win)

Result streams back to UI via SSE. 

All randomness is verifiable on-chain -- no trust required.

rankings.description: Aegis402 is a Capital-Backed Credit Layer for x402 Agent Payments, powered by EigenCompute. Service agents stake once, and we compute a credit limit from stake × ERC-8004 reputation. Clients pay agents directly via x402, and if a service agent fails or ghosts, the client is compensated from the agent’s collateral. This turns x402 from “pay and hope they deliver” into “pay and get guaranteed delivery by collateral and credit.”

rankings.description: Mnemonic Hunt is an onchain puzzle game where a Base wallet holding 100 USDC is locked behind a 24 word BIP39 mnemonic that no human ever sees. The mnemonic is generated and held entirely inside a secure enclave. Players purchase AI generated image clues that symbolically encode multiple mnemonic words without any text. By analyzing these visual clues, players attempt to reconstruct the full mnemonic. The first to succeed unlocks the wallet and claims the reward.

rankings.description:
HILT is a middleware solution for autonomous agent economies (e.g., x402 payment flows). It solves the rogue / hallucinating agent problem by decoupling transaction preparation from transaction execution.
- Preparation: The AI agent navigates paywalls and captures the payment requirements.
- The Loop: The agent is paused and a payment request is pushed to the HILT interface (mobile/web), notifying the user with a human-readable summary.
- Execution: The user signs on their device with the wallet

PPS leverages x402 to enable fraction-of-a-cent payments for video streaming. This demo application showcases the concept by letting users share paywalled video links with friends. Each viewer can only watch after making a tiny, per-view (or per-time) payment.
